svg.style: font-family: 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 18px; background-color: white; text-rendering: optimizeLegibility; -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased;

text.tspan: GDP per capita vs Self-reported Life Satisfaction, 2014
Vertical axis shows national average self-reported life satisfaction in the Cantril Ladder (a scale ranging from 0-10
where 10 is the highest possible life satisfaction). Horizontal axis shows GDP per capita based on purchasing power
parity (i.e. GDP per head after adjusting for inflation and cross-country price differences).
GDP per capita, PPP (in constant 2011 int-$)
Source: World Bank, World Happiness Report (2018)
